overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a pragmatic approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It prioritizes handling daily seasonality and weekday/weekend patterns while acknowledging data constraints. The analyst considers advanced models like SARIMA and STL decomposition but opts for a simple averaging method due to insufficient historical data, focusing on practical implementation and format compliance.
common_data_patterns: Presence of negative values (especially on weekends)
Complete data in provided window (no missing values)
key_insights: Using day-type grouping (weekday/weekend) for pattern separation improves forecast relevance
Limited data (4 days) necessitates simplified methods over complex statistical models
Forecast horizon length (96 points) exceeds practical model-fitting capabilities given history size
Data rounding (3 decimals) maintains consistency with input format
Explicit date handling ensures alignment between forecast periods and temporal patterns
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong heuristic focus: Combines data inspection, model consideration (SARIMA/STL), and practical simplification. Balances statistical awareness with executable solutions under constraints.
